intro: Erigeron unifloroides, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Erigeron unifloroides is often found in the western United States and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
